Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • View
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>

    public class View
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent>
    The View class creates and manages the GUI for the application. It doesn't know anything about the game itself, it just displays the current state of the Model, and handles user input

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage window)
        This method is responsible for creating the GUI. It creates first a main menu that asks for username and shows a start button. Once the start button is pressed startButtonClick(ActionEvent event) is called to start the first level and manage what happens next.
        Parameters:
        infoText - this is a label at the top of the page that shows the game title on the start menu and the score once 'start' is pressed. To style it, it uses webfonts by Google.
        setTextFill is used to target the CSS without modifying the stylesheet http://www.java2s.com/Code/Java/JavaFX/SetLabelTextcolor.htm(@see only)
        See Also:
        http://fxexperience.com/2012/12/use-webgoogle-fonts-in-javafx/

      • startButtonClick

        public void startButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Event handler for start button it sets some buttons as invisible and it calls startGame from the Model in order to start the first game.

      • update

        public void update()
